titleStmt.title: [Receipt] 1814 Mar. 31, The United States to Timothy Meigs for articles for encouragement of agriculture and manufactures amongst the Cherokee : a machine readable transcription of an image

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

availability.p: This work is the property of the Special Collections Library, University of Tennessee, Knoxville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Special Collections Librarian, Hoskins Library, University of Tennessee, 1401 Cumberland Avenue, Knoxville, TN 37996. (865) 974-4480.

bibl.title: [Receipt] 1814 Mar. 31, The United States to Timothy Meigs for articles for encouragement of agriculture and manufactures amongst the Cherokee
bibl.note: This document is a receipt dated March 31st 1814 from the United States government to Timothy Meigs, agent for the Cherokee Indians, for various articles to encouragement of agriculture and manufacturing.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div1.head: The United States To Timothy Meigs Dr.
div1.p:
1814
Jaury1st To 57 pr cotton cards@ 200 cts114.00
” 261 pr. ditto@ 240 ”626.40
”69 pr. Ditto@ 280 ”193.20
”12 ½lbs Crawley stew@ 40 cts.5.00
” Blister Ditto @ 25 cts2.00
” 79 lbs Tobacco@ ½13.16 2/3 ―953.76 2/3 The above given to the Cherokee
” 4th To 4 yds cotton cloth paid David Edingtonexpress from Genl Jackson2.00
March 4th To 1 Blanket paid a Cherokee for carryingdispatcher from Turkey Town to Hightower7.00
”To 1 Blanket paid a Cherokee as messengerfrom Hightower to Highwassee6.00
” 25th ” To 8 yds Cotton Cloth @ 75 cts paid aCherokee express from Turkey Town6.00
”To 5½ quiro of paper@ 50 cts2.75
”1 paper Ink powder .25
”ten Quills .62½
”70 Gun flints 1.40
”90 lb Tobacco@ ½15.00 20.02
” The above sent to the Cherokee warriors outwith Genl. Jackson―
”To 1½ Doz. Spelling Books@ 2/36.75
”1 Doz. Americans Primmers@ 12 ½1.50
The above furnished a Cherokee―
carried forward$1003.04
To Amt. Brot forward1003.04
March 29thTo 4 yds. muslin @ 3/92.50
½ lb nails @ .12½
for shroud & coffin for the decent2.62½
interment of a woman who died in the Garrison1005.66½Received of Return J Meigs one Thousand & Six dollars five Dollars & sixty six ½ cents in full payment of the above account_

Timothy Meigs' receipt pay for articles for the encouragement of Agriculture and manufactures amongst the Cherokees_for Indian runner to & from General Jacksons Army. Tobacco & Stationary for the Cherokee warriors. School Books for Indian Schools &c &c &c. ― $1005.66 ― 31st March 1814
